title: Hearings Operations
purpose: Schedule, prepare for, and record outcomes of court proceedings throughout the litigation lifecycle

workflowContext.dataFlow: Hearings are created from cases, scheduled at courts with judges, and generate tasks and documents upon conclusion

commonWorkflows.name: Schedule New Hearing
steps: Select case from dropdown or navigate from case page
Choose hearing date and time slot
Select forum (court) and bench if applicable

commonWorkflows.name: Record Hearing Outcome
steps: Open concluded hearing from calendar or list
Select outcome type (Adjourned, Order Passed, Dismissed, etc.)
Enter order summary and key points
If adjourned: Schedule next hearing date
If order: Create follow-up tasks as needed

commonWorkflows.name: Weekly Calendar Review
steps: Review all hearings for next 7 days
Verify team availability for hearing dates

commonWorkflows.name: Hearing Preparation (Day Before)
steps: Verify all documents are uploaded and accessible
Check case timeline for recent developments

warnings.title: Rescheduling Does Not Notify Parties
warnings.message: When you reschedule a hearing, the system records the change but does NOT automatically send notifications. Always send manual notifications to all parties.

warnings.title: Record Outcomes Promptly
warnings.message: Unrecorded hearing outcomes delay task creation and timeline updates. Record outcomes within 24 hours of hearing.

warnings.title: Conflict Detection
warnings.message: The system detects scheduling conflicts when the same advocate has overlapping hearings. Conflicts are shown in red on the calendar.

warnings.title: Batch Scheduling
warnings.message: For multiple hearings on same day at same court, use batch scheduling to save time.
